page.title: 09Entertainment-Featherstone
page.content: The main type of entertainment in the town are the public houses,working men's clubs and the bingo hall. The town does boast its own Amateur, Musical and Dramatic Society which was started in 1944.Most of its members live in Featherstone or Pontefract and meet twice a week.Some families have long association with the society. Performances were held at the Welfare Centre until the Civic Centre was built at Castleford.Usually they have two performances a year,one in June when a Gilbert and Sullivan Opera is staged and a November pantomime.Many costumes are made by the company but specialist wear is hired as is some of the scenery.The musicians come from the local youth orchestras and some are related to members of the company. The company perform at charity affairs.
